definition: (idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
words/speech/to say/to talk
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: In itself it would not embody anything unclear or contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 理想自身不會包含任何不清不楚或言行一致的東西。

sentences.english: In office, he kept his word.
sentences.chinese: 在辦公室裏，他言行一致。

sentences.english: For companies and individuals as much as for governments, deeds will henceforward have to match words.
sentences.chinese: 不論對企業，個人還是政府，從今以後都得言行一致。
神是言行一致的，不變的神。

sentences.english: If your deeds were as good as your words, I would thank you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的言行一致，我會謝謝你的。

sentences.english: Don't believe, you count nearby those people to speak few preach.
sentences.chinese: 不信，你細數身邊那些說過話的人沒有幾個言行一致。

sentences.english: Always the seer is a sayer.
One's conduct should agree with his words.

definition: lit. heart and mouth as one (idiom); to say what you think/honest and straightforward
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
external appearance and inner thoughts coincide (idiom); to say what one means/to think and act as one
to be strict with oneself
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
one must be a man of his word and resolute in his work (proverb)
